Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. slid safely into second base ahead of the tag from Michael Massey, and Alex Verdugo followed with a run-scoring single that gave the New York Yankees the lead for good in a 6-5 win over the Kansas City Royals in their AL Division Series opener on Saturday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro said, 'They just said there was nothing clear and convincing to overturn it, and if he had been called out, that call would have stood, too.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first postseason game with five lead changes, the score was 5-5 when Chisholm singled against Michael Lorenzen leading off the seventh.
Others: The umpire in the Rockefeller Center replay operations center, Chris Conroy, spent about two minutes checking an array of video in rectangles on a large screen inches in front of him.
